title: Sindhis
summary: Sindhis (Sindhi: سنڌي‎ (Perso-Arabic), सिन्धी (Devanagari),  (Khudabadi)) are an Indo-Aryan ethnic group who speak the Sindhi language and are native to the Sindh region in Pakistan, located along the lower course of the Indus River as it flows on its journey from the Himalayas to the Arabian Sea. Today, ethnic Sindhis are found predominantly in Pakistan while a minority resides in India.
